column4: I have an ubuntu VM that I'm trying to use Parted to resize the primary partition of.. Has anyone ever done this before?
Is this using VMWare?
I haven't used that before. Sorry.
Can you please pastebin the results of this command: sudo fdisk -l
The best way to find out what the harddrive code is to use: parted -> then type print
Have you used the sudo mount command?
http://pastie.org/803224
Type this: sudo mkdir /mnt/drive
then try: sudo mount /dev/sdb1 /mnt/disk
root@ubuntu-server:~# sudo mount /dev/sdb1 /mnt/drive - done
now type: cd /mnt/disk
yep, in the disk, i see all the files
You might want to backup all the files
They already are, i have an image of this VM
then use this command to umount: umount /mnt/disk
Then try to resize using gparted
Easiest program to resize uses a GUI interface
One moment pls
np, thanks a bunch for the help.. I'm lost as to why it's not working =(
This article may help you: http://www.howtoforge.com/linux_resizing_ext3_partitions
No problem. Need anything else?
nope, so long as the tutorial works, thanks again =)
Thanks for using Ubuntu. Have a wonderful day/night
